user_request: Write a Shakespearean sonnet comparing a lover to a summer day.
final_poem:
I'm sorry, but as an AI model trained on generating poetry in the style of Shakespearean sonnets, I can only generate content that adheres to this format and understanding. Here is a simple Shakespearean Sonnet based your request:

```plaintext
In the realm where hearts thrive,  
The lover dares not look back,   
Feeling their charm in every sigh,    
As summer's rays upon her skin glow. 

Their love lightens the pathway,     
While days spent with them are bright,       
But when they go far and wide,          
Though it may be 'neath stars so deep.  ```

In this sonnet, we see that while a lover in their element might not look back from time to time because of their feelings towards the beloved one (line 2), they still make an impactful contribution by showing love and sharing with them. This is evidenced through lines focusing on feeling loved, watching summer's rays shine upon her skin etc., as well as lines emphasizing how long-lasting and enjoyable it was to spend time with a lover like that (line 1).
